formulas.name: Rate of Change
formulas.description: Derivative gives instantaneous rate of change

formulas.name: Slope of Tangent
formulas.description: Evaluate derivative at the given point to get slope

formulas.name: Equation of Tangent
formulas.formula: y − y₁ = m(x − x₁) where m = f'(x₁)
formulas.description: Tangent line touches curve at exactly one point locally

formulas.name: Equation of Normal
formulas.formula: y − y₁ = −(1/m)(x − x₁) where m = f'(x₁)
formulas.description: Normal is perpendicular to tangent. Slope of normal = −1/slope of tangent

formulas.name: Increasing Function
formulas.description: Function is increasing where derivative is positive

formulas.name: Decreasing Function
formulas.description: Function is decreasing where derivative is negative

formulas.name: Critical Point
formulas.description: Points where function may have local maxima, minima, or inflection

formulas.name: First Derivative Test
formulas.formula: f' changes from + to − → local max; f' changes from − to + → local min
formulas.description: Check sign change of f' around critical point

formulas.name: Second Derivative Test
formulas.formula: At f'(c)=0: f''(c) > 0 → local min; f''(c) < 0 → local max
formulas.description: Faster than first derivative test when f'' is easy to compute. Inconclusive if f''(c) = 0.

formulas.name: Point of Inflection
formulas.description: Point where concavity changes from up to down or vice versa

formulas.name: Linear Approximation / Error
formulas.description: Approximate change in function using derivative

formulas.name: L'Hôpital's Rule
formulas.formula: lim f(x)/g(x) = lim f'(x)/g'(x) for 0/0 or ∞/∞ forms
formulas.description: Differentiate numerator and denominator separately. Can apply repeatedly.
formulas.use_case: Use when direct substitution gives indeterminate form

formulas.name: Global Max/Min on Closed Interval
formulas.formula: Compare f(a), f(b), and f(c) where f'(c) = 0
formulas.description: Evaluate function at endpoints and all critical points in [a,b]
